alert.note: Alert for Duplin (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued December 17 at 3:05PM EST until December 17 at 3:45PM EST by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Newport has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Duplin County in eastern North Carolina... * Until 345 PM EST. * At 304 PM EST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Harrells to 6 miles north of Rowan to near Kelly, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Wallace, Warsaw, Mount Olive, Rose Hill, Bowdens, Beautancus, Kenansville, Harrells, Sarecta, Faison, Magnolia, Greenevers, Calypso, and Teachey. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EST for eastern North Carolina. A Tornado Watch remains in effect for the warned area. Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. Although a tornado is not immediately likely, if one is spotted, act quickly and move to a place of safety inside a sturdy structure such as a basement or small interior room. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please send your reports of hail and/or wind damage, including trees or large limbs downed, by calling the National Weather Service office in Newport at 1-800-889-6889.
